Portable OpenNTPD

The portable version of OpenNTPD adds support for other Unix flavors by adding autotool support and the necessary compatibility layer. OpenNTPD portable borrows heavily from the OpenSSH and LibreSSL portable projects.

Platform Requirements

  • adjtime(2) and settimeofday(2) syscalls or equivalent.
  • adjfreq(2) or an equivalent compatibility function
  • daemon(3), setresgid(2), setresuid(2) or equivalent
  • A working arc4random(3) or getentropy(2) implementation

The more of these interfaces that are implemented natively by an operating system, the higher the chance a portable version will just work. If your operating system is unsupported, encourage your OS vendor to support these secure and simple APIs.

At the time of writing, OpenNTPD portable is known to build and work on:

  • OpenBSD (5.6)
  • Linux (Ubuntu 12.04, 14.04)
  • FreeBSD (9.x, 10.x)
  • NetBSD (6.1.5)
  • Solaris (10.x, 11.x)
  • Mac OS X (10.9)

OpenNTPD may work on other operating systems, newer and older, but the above ones are tested regularly by the developers. Reports (success or otherwise) are welcome. You may report bugs or submit pull requests at the GitHub project: https://github.com/openntpd-portable

OpenNTPD 3.9p1 and earlier also supported these operating systems, but they are not supported with the latest version yet.

  • HP-UX (work in progress)
  • QNX4 (untested)
  • IRIX (untested, missing arc4random/getentropy)
  • AIX (untested, missing arc4random/getentropy)

Download

Index
HTTP mirrors
FTP mirrors
RSYNC mirrors
